text: Viral infection alters the plasma membrane integrity and ionic efflux, which could lead to programmed cell death and induce the secondary activation of NLRP3 inflammasome. The process of viral replication causes lytic cell death and subsequent potassium efflux, which provides the second signal for NLRP3 inflammasome activation (62) . The PB1-F2 protein from IAV induces oxidative stress and the alteration of mitochondrial calcium, leading to apoptosis and NLRP3 inflammasome activation (63) .
